thread.title: Antonio Conte: I want to match Jose Mourinho's Chelsea trophy haul
thread.title_full: Antonio Conte: I want to match Jose Mourinho's Chelsea trophy haul

author: simon johnson
title: Antonio Conte: I want to match Jose Mourinho's Chelsea trophy haul
text:
Antonio Conte admits he is aiming to match Jose Mourinho 's trophy haul as Chelsea manager. 
Mourinho won seven major trophies during his two spells in charge at Stamford Bridge, including three Premier League titles. 
Conte, who is expected   on the three-year contract he signed last summer, looks on course to claim his first championship at Chelsea as they boast a 10-point lead in the top flight. 
Chelsea could even win the Double in his debut season, although face a tough task against Mourinho's Manchester United side in the FA Cup quarter-final on Monday night. Chelsea vs Manchester United: FA Cup preview 
Conte is full of respect for the Special One's achievements during his time at Chelsea and said: "His history with Chelsea was great. I know very well he's in the heart of Chelsea's fans. 
"It's great this because he deserves it. For sure, I hope in the future to emulate his wins here.” 
Mourinho used to be worshipped by Chelsea's following but has made numerous digs at his former club's expense since moving to Old Trafford last summer. Chelsea v Man United: FA Cup match preview 
But Conte believes that won't damage his status as a Chelsea legend. 
He added: "Jose Mourinho wrote a good part of the history of Chelsea. He won a lot with the players. He did a great job here in Chelsea. It's important, always, not to forget this. 
"I have great respect for him because he's a winner. I like his mentality. He has a winning mentality. For sure, he's one of the best in the world and, here, he did a great job. I think every single fan must respect him.” Read more Conte plays down Pogba vs Kante battle and warns Chelsea over Utd star 
Mourinho has made many negative comments about Chelsea's style of play. Only last month he sneered about the praise the Blues and Conte were getting by saying: "To be good in counter attack is suddenly art." 
But Conte has revealed that it is a tactic that he hasn't spent any time practising all season and just comes naturally to his players during the 90 minutes. 
He said: “I have to tell you one thing, not only here... but I never, ever, ever train for the counter-attack. Never prepare for the counter-attack. Never. Chelsea vs Manchester United: Head to head 
"I think the counter-attack is an option, above all if you have this type of player, players who are very, very fast. 
"Diego Costa is a counter-attacking man, Eden Hazard, Willian and Pedro. It's normal to have this situation with space, so they know what they can do. 
"For me, it's important to train the other aspects: when we have the ball, when we stay almost always in our opponents' half, to prepare when we are attacking. It's very difficult to train counter-attacking, but it's not my priority.” More about:
